question.text: Which scientist/worker is not matched correctly with its work/contribution?

options.text: Oparin and Haldane - Given most acceptable theory for origin of life.
Charles Darwin - Given most acceptable theory for evolution of life.
Thomas Malthus - He has written Assay on population.
Hugo de Vries - Gave the theory of germplasm.

solution.text:
Mutation theory (given by Hugo deVries)

Based on his work on Evening primrose (first decade of 20th century).

Mutations can suddenly cause large variations in a population.

Mutations were random and directionless.

According to Hugo de Vries, evolution (or speciation) is caused by mutation so he gave term to it - saltation (single step large mutation).
